definition: classics/sacred book/scripture/to pass through/to undergo/to bear/to endure/warp (textile)/longitude/menstruation/channel (TCM)/abbr. for economics 經濟|经济[jing1 ji4]
abbr. for 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]

sentences.english: Ding Hong great learning, who has researched the book right through.
sentences.chinese: 丁鴻很有學問，對經書極有研究。

sentences.english: When he was but twelve years old he was already studying Tendai philosophical speculation.
sentences.chinese: 他十二歲時已經開始研習天台宗經書。

sentences.english: Xuanzang built the pagoda in order to have a place for his Buddhist books.
sentences.chinese: 玄奘修建大雁塔是爲了存放經書。

sentences.english: I can, t give that out without written approval.
sentences.chinese: 沒經書面批准，我不能給你。

sentences.english: Making time for reading religious and sacred texts is a challenge in our own time.
sentences.chinese: 而我們的時代，騰出時間閱讀宗教經書卻是件難事。

sentences.english: The book closes with the Israelites residing in Egypt.
sentences.chinese: 經書結束時以色列人定居埃及。

sentences.english: Unless they are proper books written by sages, we should avoid reading them.
sentences.chinese: 若非聖賢所傳述的正經書，一定摒棄不看。

sentences.english: The leaves of the sutra Merely stir a sad wind.
sentences.chinese: 只剩頁頁經書擾起一股悲風。

sentences.english: They simply weren't considered to be of the same status as the 24 books.
sentences.chinese: 但這些作品和那24卷經書無法具有同等地位。

definition: gate to enlightment (Buddhism)/Buddhism/way/method/(old) south gate of a palace
to study attentively (a book)/to delve into
volumes of classics/volumes of scriptures/ancient scrolls
